name: Bourbon Convention Ibirapuera

reviews.text: The Bourbon Ibirapuera is in a busy area of Sao Paulo and was convenient to the office that I was visiting. Based on earlier reviews, I set my expectations low and they were, unfortunately, not exceeded. Service was usually pretty good at the front desk, but I was surprised on my first business day that there was no bell captain to help me communicate with the cab driver, who did not speak English. Later in the week, there were a couple of people assisting guests, when the hotel seemed to have some kind of convention business.
reviews.title: About average and in line with other reviews

reviews.text: Everything about the Hotel Bourbon indicates that management is trying to save as much money as possible. The carpets are unattractive with visible wear and seams that just don't blend in. The worst part, however, is the hall lighting which is activated by motion sensors. As you get out of the elevators, you see a dark hallway in front of you that is suddenly (although poorly) illuminated. Unfortunately, the light in front of my room was burned out, so it was always a trick to get the card key into the slot to open my door.
reviews.title: A surprising let down

reviews.text: There is certainly nothing special about the Bourbon, but I have stayed in worse places. "Average" is about the most complimentary word I can think of. The breakfast buffet is mediocre, as was the dinner fare in the only full service restaurant in the hotel. There are a couple of decent restaurants in the nearby shopping mall, which has also seen better days. If I had to stay here again, I could, but not without checking for a better alternative.
reviews.title: Mid Grade - could be great with some care

reviews.text: It used to be a very good hotel when managed by the Blue tree group. But since acquired by Bourbon group the standards have fallen alarmingly. The rooms, health club, all now have a run down look and the service standards have fallen down. The only advantage is the location which is next to the Iberapuera shopping mall.
reviews.title: Great location, but will stay elsewhere next trip

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 weeks for an extended business trip. Hotel has potential but not being realized. Staff is very hit and miss: a couple of truly excellent people on staff but when those aren't on duty it's hard to say what you will get for service. Always at least one person on staff with very good English skills which was nice. Visually, very clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: A value for money hotel...
Nice business hotel close to the national...
reviews.text: Nice business hotel close to the national airport. Clean rooms and decent breakfast.

reviews.title: Fine

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel with a group of colleagues for tree nights and found it to be pleasant with a good location. Sao Paulo is so big that everyplace is a far distance from someplace else. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was good but not spectacular. The lobby is quite small and always seemed packed with folks coming or going.
reviews.title: A nice place for convention and business

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay there, nice and clean roon, although some noise from airplanes taking off Congonhas Airport (couple of miles far).
reviews.title: Hotel is sliding in the wrong direction

reviews.text: Excellent location, Ibirapuera Mall (wich is huge) is around the corner, airport is a cheap taxi ride far.
reviews.title: Nothing Special.

reviews.text: This hotel is on par with most older Sheratons and Hiltons, perhaps even a cut above. Most women won't like the rooms because they lack a good lighted mirror and a full-length mirror. The shower is powerful but basic, and there's no tub. However the room is good size, the beds are comfortable, the bed linens are of good quality, and everything is clean.
reviews.title: Good for a male solo traveler

reviews.text: I had a deluxe room overlooking the courtyard and while I could hear airport noise in the morning, it wasn't a bother. The internet charge is consistent with most other hotels in Sao Paulo. Breakfast was included in my rate and it was adequate.
reviews.title: Surely worth a long stay

reviews.text: The area around the hotel is upscale and walkable, and there are many popular restaurants nearby. The mall next door is large and popular with Brazilians and has pretty much anything you might need but luxury goods are quite expensive in Brazil so it's nothing to get excited about.
reviews.title: Mediocre service, lots of noise, but value-for-money
Mosquito Problem / Not a Hotel for the International Traveller / Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for more than 2 months on a business trip and was really put to minimal inconvenience throughout (except for one time when they made me change my room due to some maintenance round). Location is quite central - next to a mall, across the road from an all-you-need-supermarket, laundry centre (doing laundry at the hotel itself is quite expensive) and lots of restaurants around. Right on the main road - Avenida Ibirapuera gives good access to the city via the public bus transport. Rooms were a little compact but not suffocating. Complimentary breakfast was very sumptuous and the restaurant itself was not a bad option for lunch/dinner. Facilities of well-equipped fitness centre, swimming pool, sauna and free internet in the room ensured that the long stay didn't become burdensome.
reviews.title: Good for a short business stay

reviews.text: The redeeming quality of the hotel is its location. but for the price, the level of comfort and quality is way below par: stained carpets, AC does not cool, tiny bathroom, hot water scant and spartan amenities. Bedding would be OK if it weren't for the darn plastic matress liner that only reminds you of the possible creepy crawlers lurking underneath the sheets.
reviews.title: Tired, used and in dire needs of renovation

reviews.text: Breakfast is a buffet-sttyle without any style.
reviews.title: Tired, poor service, but good location

reviews.text: At rush hour, plan for 10 extra minutes to get the elevator to your floor and another 20 minutes to check out. If you have a car parked, that's another 10 minutes: that's 30 to 40 minutes wasted out of your work day.
reviews.title: No nonsense business hotel

reviews.text: Staff is generally friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Large comfortable business hotel

reviews.text: The place needs a major facelift. Overall, this is a facility that has far too long rested on its laurels and is not in a "business hotels" class.
reviews.title: Business-oriented hotel with great staff

description: Placed in Moema neighborhood, right next to Ibirapuera shopping mall, the hotel allows easy access to major avenues in São Paulo, being located just a few kilometers from Ibirapuera Park, which offers leisure and relaxing moments.
